subject: Re: [sugar] Web activity & ebook reading
body:
On Sun, 2007-05-06 at 10:46 -0500, Ian Bicking wrote:
> Marco Pesenti Gritti wrote:
> > 1 Hook up pyxpcom support to sugar.Browser. In theory this would allow
> > you to access the full xpcom mozilla API from python. My only doubt
> > about this approach is that pyxpcom has not been used a lot so far (and
> > development does not seem to be very active).
> 
> I've sent a message to the pyxpcom list asking about this: 
> http://aspn.activestate.com/ASPN/Mail/Message/pyxpcom/3472110


Thanks.

It would be probably good to mention that we would like to use
gtkmozembed + pyxpcom. Python only embedding does not seem very
realistic in our timeframe.

I'm not sure what you mean exactly with "something more conservative
like Firefox" but if you mean to implement the Read activity in XUL, I
think that's a bad idea (it would make integration with Sugar way too
difficult).

Marco
